results.title: Insect life cycle: the periodical cicada. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the Periodical Cicada. The camera traces it from egg-laying, through the years underground, and the emergence from the nymph state, to the mating of the mature adult. Time-lapse photography is used to show a nymph emerging, and the process that follows to development of the wings of a mature adult.

results.title: Insect lab
results.brief_description: How scientists at the Insect Pathology Laboratory of the federal Department of Agriculture produce a virus which kills the pine sawfly. Narrated by Julian Biggs.

results.title: Insect foods
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to show what and how insects eat, and to illustrate how the feeding habits of insects affect man. Shows clearly the feeding habits of certain insects. Could stimulate further discussion and interest and may kindle the enthusiasm of young people to aim at a career in entomology.

results.title: Insect collecting
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: How an insect collection can be established. Representative terrestial and aquatic insects are studied in extreme close-up photography, collecting methods shown include netting, beating host plants, night collecting, investigating dead trees, using the Beriese funnel to procure microscopic speciments, and aquatic methods.

results.title: Insearch of viewable objects
results.creator_credit: Jane Nicholls and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the voyeur, showing the pleasure, pain and confusion. This is a student film which explores the main character’s voyeuristic experiences from boyhood to manhood who, eventually has the cameras turned on him at the end of the film - the “watcher” has now become the “watched”! Cinematography by John Tweg.

results.title: Insatiable
results.brief_description: A stylised, abstract musical narrative working around ideas of “performance”. Four singers who arrive at an old theatre for an audition. As they wait their turn to be called to perform, the singers gradually reveal through songs more about their pasts and speculate on their possible futures.

group_works.title: How to innovate
group_works.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia

results.title: Innovation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Enterprise”.
Features John Tench, an industrial scientist who views himself as an incarnation of the traditional American inventor. Features the history of innovation in US technology; electronics, manufacturing, transportation, communications, engineering and business. The role of the US Patent Office is explained.

results.title: Innocent strangers
results.creator_credit: Jose Quijano, Joe O'Brien and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A short television film featuring refugee stories from various parts of the world including the plight of 1,000,000 in Palestine. The film was originally produced by the United Nations Office of Public Information World Refugee Year. Narrated by Ralph Bellamy.
